Ian Guffick asked pupils to make changes to their SATs exam answers, despite the exam session having finished at Mitton Manor Primary School in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire. The teacher also altered a number of the pupil's exam answers himself, leading to a probe that found that some pupils taking a test had changed answers outside exam conditions and that Guffick had done the same. The Department for Education annulled the whole school. It also emerged that Guffick had his teaching license suspended for two years.
